website_summaries.verdict: The JLab Epics may look a little cheap, but they offer a comfortable, secure fit, and sound richer than their design would indicate.
pros: The JLab Epics are lightweight in-ear headphones that deliver good sound for a relatively modest price
They also fit comfortably, have a tangle-resistant flat cord, and come with a few different-sized Cush Fins that make them sit very securely in your ear
Additionally, they have a one-button universal inline remote/microphone and come with a decent protective carrying case

website_summaries.verdict: The wireless JLab Epic are solid fitness-focused earphones for workouts fueled by big bass.
pros: Powerful, distortion-free audio performance with deep bass presence

customer_reviews.title: Interference during a calls
customer_reviews.text: Superb headphones. But the one thing I really needed them for and that no one seems to test or comment on in reviews is call quality. I returned as there’s a bit of interference and it’s impossible to speak with both ears in. That said, just returned my Powerbeats 3 also as they are horrendous in calls, like calling from inside an electric razor whilst inside a washing machine
customer_reviews.author: Firms

customer_reviews.title: Faulty after less than 5 months of use light use
customer_reviews.text: These headphones worked great for almost 5 months. Then repeatedly disconnected from my phone and tablet during use. Now they will not reconnect. Didn't even last 6 months. No option on Amazon to return after the first 6 weeks. Not good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Metcalf

customer_reviews.title: I was happy on receiving
customer_reviews.text: I was happy on receiving, did what is said on the tin but that did not last long, battery problems. I got a refund and replaced with same but again they failed after about 3 months, contacted JLab who replaced, but they lasted about 5 months, sorry but for the price I would expect more, would not recommend anyone buying them, they just are not up to the job.
customer_reviews.author: Mr G A R Watt

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and hold. Great sound but not durable enough!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these headphones last year - the sound and fit were excellent but they died within a few months (unable to charge). I got a full refund and decided to try them again but this time they only lasted 3 weeks before completely failing again. Reading other reviews people have had the same issues. There is clearly a problem with this product. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Hirst

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Not very good sound quality in my opinion ear phones for £5 at tesco sound a lot better
customer_reviews.author: David jarvis

customer_reviews.title: A lot of ££ for some fancy packaging!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for running and needed something durable and waterproof, they broke after 3 months would never buy from this company again. That price is high but you don't get what you pay for I'm afraid.
customer_reviews.author: Michael86

customer_reviews.title: Bad mic and not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The mic quality was very bad I couldn't hear a word on the other end and they aren't very comfortable in ear. I saw the YouTube video reviews say it was good but they just aren't
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Whooley

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: They worked fine for about 6 months and the they stopped working after getting weat with sweat
customer_reviews.author: Arturo

customer_reviews.title: Best i have had so far
customer_reviews.text: Best for running. fits perfectly. Enjoying my fitness so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Apparently not sweat proof
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Takes a fair amount of adjustment to finally achieve a good fit. The left ear bud began to malfunction after the first real sweat I worked up wearing them while cycling. Very faint volume in left bud now. I went through all of the recommended steps and checks to correct the problem, but no luck. Attempted to begin the warranty replacement process, but the online form repeatedly malfunctioned. When I informed the company, via email, of their form problem, I was advised that, ahem, I must use the form to begin the warranty process. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Victor A. Spooner

customer_reviews.title: Sweat Magnet & Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair since the company replaced the last two pairs as they died within one year (a few months for both.) The biggest issue with these aside from how frequently they break is their sweat magnet nature. While they''re fine in the winter, the design of these draws sweat from above your ears and redirects it into your ear canal. So if you're looking for ears filled with sweat then look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Photo Pro

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing fit and feel
customer_reviews.text: My beloved JayBird Bluebuds X started being finicky on Bluetooth so I decied to upgrade to something newer. After reading reviews from wirecutter I decided to give these a try. The fit was just terrible, and the memory-wire made it continually so. After a week of fighting with them, I gave up and went back to the JayBird set. The microphone was completely useless when behind my head. I've found this to be the case for the JayBird series as well, but with those I can move the wire to the front of my face, but with these the memory-wire prevents that completely. The lack of JayBird's in-ear wedges means they were always loose.
customer_reviews.author: W. Shaver

customer_reviews.title: Best sound I have heard from any wireless headphone
customer_reviews.text: Just wore my JBL epic 2 wireless ear phones today working out. Great sound, really nice malleable wire to adjust how it fits on your ear. Several choices for the soft ear plug to put in your ear to get just the right fit. Easy pairing to my phone; just follow the pairing instructions. Although this product is expensive it is worth the price. I have bought numerous wired and wireless headphones; this is the best I have ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: Steve F

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THESE THINGS.....
customer_reviews.text: ..... So much that I got two more in case I lose or break the one. Have burned through quite a few dollars on other brands in this price range trying and this one beat them out. Pros: -price was great -construction is excellent: highly durable plug, cord, earpieces. -driver size -performance is excellent: highly sensitive/clear mic, high power handling/dynamic range without breakup, crisp airy detailed highs,clear mids and strong lows when driven with good EQ and external AMP (FiiO A3@450mw) and premium earbud tips (Bose QuietComfort fit perfect). Cons: -need more power to goose them to performance levels than others.
customer_reviews.author: TCCozby

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality, bad bluetooth connection
customer_reviews.text: Nice sound quality, comfortable and a good fit for my ears. However, there are clearly connection issues with the Bluetooth that need to be fixed. I get skips and crackles all the time when I'm working out, even if my phone (Android) is within a few feet of these headphones. I was biking today with my phone in my backpack, literally a foot from the headphones, and there are still skips, crackling, and dropped connections averaging once or twice per song. Not a deal breaker - it never looses the connection altogether - but enough to be distracting and annoying. Especially since the company specifically advertises "skip-free" sound in the product title. I may return these and try another pair.
customer_reviews.author: CDHenderson

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit, not sweat proof undoes all the other positives.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these based off of some positive reviews (Wirecutter, etc). Sound when the buds are fully in is quite good, with better than average bass....when the buds are fully in. On the downside, none of the tips really work to keep the buds in that position. This is further exacerbated by exercise, which ruins most the the whole point of buying these. As other reviews have mentioned, they are also not sweat-proof, so mine died after a spin class. Warranty return won't be accepted, so things I won't ever be buying again...JLab products.
customer_reviews.author: cdrikari

customer_reviews.title: A true failure of a successor.
customer_reviews.text: I had the previous headphones of this line. Still have them and they're perfect. Amazing. Have had them for YEARS. These? Started awesome. Really. You couldn't find a problem with them at first. Comfortable fit, sound is acceptable, battery life is amazing. I've had them like 3 weeks now I think. The Bluetooth connection has gotten so weak it disconnects if I walk. I have to have my phone within 1ft of it. If it's in my pants pocket it skips really bad and cuts out. These aren't worth $10 to me. Please don't buy these. Try to find the previous line. They are amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: but the customer service from Jlab is wonderful. I have very small ear canals and lost ...
customer_reviews.text: Not only have these earbuds exceeded my expectations, but the customer service from Jlab is wonderful. I have very small ear canals and lost one of the only tips that fit in my ear. I contacted Jlab and wanted to purchase a replacement set in the same color as my earbuds and they said they'd send them out free of charge! Thesr earbuds are excellent quality, have withstood a small baby chewing on them (by accident!!) and my super sweaty workouts. I am a Jlab customer for life!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Overall dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: TL;DR They sound bad, get the Monoprice 9927's they sound excellent Pros: The anti tangle cable is amazing and works well, I don't know why they are not on more headphones. The case is also nice. Cons: Most in ear headphones fit my ear great, these however hurt my ear. They really don't sound good at all, disappointing since many people are calling them "audiophile on budget earbuds" I returned these and bought the Monoprice 9927's from the Monoprice website for 10 dollars and they sound way better and are much more comfortable. Highly recommend checking those out instead... but I still miss the anti tangle cable.
customer_reviews.author: Cknight70

customer_reviews.title: Nice.
customer_reviews.text: I am VERY pleased with the JLab Audio Epic2 Bluetooth wireless earbuds. Audio quality is excellent as long as my phone and the earbuds can "see" each other line of site. Occasionally, if I put my phone in my back pocket there is brief interruption of audio signal. They fit well and appear well designed and durable. I use the JLab Audio Epic2 Bluetooth wireless earbuds with my Google Nexus 6P running Android 7.1.
customer_reviews.author: D. Burbank

customer_reviews.title: Best fit you've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Module fit for the ear allowing for all sizes and types. With in the reviews that I found... They stated that they will stay on no mater what.and from what I've found is that is true to the letter. I use them, for working outside landscape, and plowing, and also working out: running, lifting, and boxing. The sound rivals most scull-candies, but not boss, or beats but that is the only draw back. the price you pay is for fit not the sound. but after searching for an amazing for over 12 years of work/working out I can finally say I've discovered a product i will always return too.
customer_reviews.author: mat clark

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life
customer_reviews.text: Great battery life. Very comfortable. Sound is loud and clear when listening to music or other audio. Only thing preventing me from giving it five stars is that I've received feedback that I don't sound super clear on the other side. They've said there's too much background sound (even if I'm in a quiet room) and that I sound like I'm in a tunnel (when I'm not!). I decided to keep them and try to use another headset for important calls. But when I'm on the run it works fine in a pinch for quick calls.
customer_reviews.author: Jess from Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Battery won't hold a charge
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. After the first full charge, the battery failed to hold a charge on subsequent charges. The charging light comes on, then eventually goes off indicating full charge, but when I turn on the earbuds the voice says "Battery at medium" and it only lasts for a few minutes before shutting down. Other than that, I was pretty happy with this unit until it simply became useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is tolerable, but there are two big ...
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is tolerable, but there are two big problems with this set, one is that the bluetooth keeps skipping/dropping out (when connected to an iphone 6s+) and the other is that it doesn't stay firmly in place when running. Seems both of these things shouldn't be an issue for a headset as expensive as this. I'm returning my pair.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Neusbaum

customer_reviews.title: Great Running Companion!
customer_reviews.text: The ear[phones work really well. I have gone for several runs with this earphone, and it has not slipped out. There are just a few issues with the design of the earphone, but these might be inevitable. The controls are on the right of the earphone, causing an asymmetry in the weight distribution. The earphones did not fit perfectly, but that's understandable since I'm ethnic Chinese and the device may have been designed for the Caucasian ears. But that's what I suspect and I can't verify the ergonomics of this. Nonetheless, a great workout companion, and hope to have many more runs with this earphone!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Choo

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these!
customer_reviews.text: Based on a recommendation by Wirecutter.com, I purchased these not once--but twice--trying to give JLab the benefit of the doubt. They failed on every count. The microphone didn't work well and I had complaints from coworkers asking me to stop using them at work because they couldn't hear/understand me. They cut off before my workout so I had to run in silence. They stopped charging and are now dead on my countertop.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Hamlyn

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it relying on the review of it being very secure and don't fall out during a workout. Well guess what? The earphones can't even stay in my ears for more than a minute of jumping rope. It's rather pricey so I tried hard to make it work. What I did was to tie a headband and making sure my ears are covered so that th he earphones stay secure. Only then can I jump rope comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: wan

customer_reviews.title: Died after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Husband purchased and loved them at first as sound was amazing... then turned to like as they were heavy on the ears and would start to slip once sweat was introduced. Not to mention you there is no microphone to answer calls on these expensive headphones? Now 4 months later they will not charge or turn on! Completely disappointed by supposedly a top notch product that was highly reviewed. Will not buy from JLab again.
customer_reviews.author: Heather L. Dudley

customer_reviews.title: Died really fast
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use while running. I run 6-7 days a week for 30 minutes to an hour. After about 1.5 weeks I started losing sound in the right ear. After 2 weeks they wouldn't power on at all.
customer_reviews.author: Erik DeBill

customer_reviews.title: Earphones died unexpectedly then wouldn't turn on. Once completely ...
customer_reviews.text: Earphones died unexpectedly then wouldn't turn on. Once completely dead the battery would function but would discharge even though they were off. Also the bluetooth signal was always cutting out when something obstructed the volume control area on the right earphone. Wish they were as sweat proof as they say.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Whittemore

customer_reviews.title: ...getting too hot to touch or keep in ears and the charge is lasting less than 2 hours
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the JLab Audio Epic2 Bluetooth 4.0 Wireless Sport Earbuds, GUARANTEED fitness, waterproof IPX5 rated, skip-free sound, pristine high-performance 8mm sound drivers, 12hr play time w/ microphone - Blue/Gray, Sold by JLab Store through Amazon as a gift on August 2, 2017. My teenage son is complaining that they are getting too hot to touch or keep in his ears and that the charge is lasting less than 2 hours. They lasted 3 months! Sent an email to the company and I am waiting for a response.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Varner

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these headphones... I was never particularly impressed with the sound quality, it sounds muddy with muted highs but decent bass. The wireless aspect is great, the size just right, and the sleeves fit well. However I had some Bluetooth connection issues (i.e. skipping) with both my iPhone and iWatch but never thought about it too much until it starting degrading recently. After two months these headphones stopped working completely, the activity light doesn't turn on anymore. I'm returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: the right earbud volume is pretty much gone
customer_reviews.text: Thought it would be a solid product based on the reviews of the first version. I was wrong. After a couple of months of use, the right earbud volume is pretty much gone. The hard rubber/plastic wire wrap that help secure it to the ear split and now its loose. It is no longer fixed in place and causes the earbud to come out frequently. I used some electrical tape to fix the wrap and it helps some. For the price I expected a lot better quality. Now I'm looking for a new pair and see that there is a lot more options. JLab needs to drastically improve quality if they want to compete with this type of product.
customer_reviews.author: A. Torres

customer_reviews.title: Great at first, wears out too quickly
customer_reviews.text: I've had these headphones for almost 8 months and I use them everyday. Best things about them: outstanding battery life! Nice volume control, good sound. Sweat or rain hasn't affected the sound or function. Worst things: interference when anything touches them (my hair, the collar of my shirt, practically unusable when wearing a hoodie). The control buttons are wearing out and the power on/off button is getting harder to use every day. The cover for the charging port hasn't stayed in place for months. Now I have started getting a very loud static "blip" every 30 seconds. I'm disappointed that they didn't last longer for the $$ I spent on them.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Okay Headphones, Failed in ~6 hours, Not Worth Hassle with JLab.  Go another route.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived late. Then, these stopped working after ~6 hours of use (less than one battery cycle). JLab's warranty requires consumer to pay S&H and wait for approval of coupon and then re-delivery of new item (totally a week or more in back and forth). Unacceptable, since I can just return these and order another (different) pair in 2 days. When these were working, the sound was fine, if a bit tinny, even by earbud standards. Paired easily with S6 edge and laptop. Charge time was a bit long, but okay.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent!
customer_reviews.text: My JLabs are fantastic! Their Bluetooth sensitivity is superior to other BT earbuds I've used. In fact if I have one complaint (which I don't) it's that if my phone isn't in my pocket when I'm using them, I can walk halfway across the gym before the signal fades and I have to walk back to get my phone. I did initially have a problem keeping them in my ears during intense aerobics, but after choosing the right earpiece and adjust the ear straps, they stay on throughout my entire workout without adjusting them.
customer_reviews.author: Ed K

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last but 3mo
customer_reviews.text: These sounded decent, a little more dropout than my prior pair, but they only worked well for 3mo of less than weekly use. Now don't hold a charge for 12h and are hard to get to power on. Shame, I like the design. Would like the ear stays to be slightly less flexible (hold form on and off). My much more expensive Jaybird X2's lasted about this long (including the factory warranty replacement). The search continues...
customer_reviews.author: RenaissanceMan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing but it breaks down after a year, lower volume on one side.
customer_reviews.text: I used to love this product, one of the best exercise headphone I have ever used but it started failing after a year. Pros: long battery life (more than a week of 1 hour daily usage at the gym) easy setup grip to your ear Cons: unfortunately after a year, the ear started being lower in volume like cheap iPhone headphone cable between headphones is too long terrible at making phone calls if you tie the long cable behind your head
customer_reviews.author: Mostafa Khaled

customer_reviews.title: 1. They are light. 2. The ear ...
customer_reviews.text: 1. They are light. 2. The ear buds come with quite a number of shapes and sizes in rubber tips - so it should be possible to find the proper fit so they stay in your ear through more aggressive movement. 3.. The sound is OK. Sufficient for me when I work out and listen to music off of a youtube play list. 4. There is a case that is small and could fit in a pocket or purse. It is somewhat hard on the outside for protection. You can fit the charging cable (USB - about 4 - 6 inches long) and the spare earbud rubber tips in a pocket inside the case.
customer_reviews.author: gmak

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Problems began with this product right off the bat. First, the range is HORRENDOUS. I couldn't put my iPhone in my pocket without the signal immediately cutting out, so when I was walking anywhere I had to keep the phone held above my chest or higher. Even just dropping my arm and having it below my waist meant the signal was lost. But, then after about 20-25 uses, the battery power became non-existent. A full charge lasted 90 minutes total. Then they just stopped working altogether. Very unhappy with this product and would not recommend it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Metal Thrashing Mad

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but not there yet.
customer_reviews.text: Tried 2 sets. Ordered the blue and returned them immediately, then tried the black ones (perhaps I just got a bad set the first time) and returned them also. Good idea, connects very easily. Comfortable and sound is a good 7/10. The problem is the intermittent loss of sound either due to wiring or drops in the blue tooth signal. Tried to live with it but it was just too annoying. Back to my wired.
customer_reviews.author: Run junkie

customer_reviews.title: I don't get a great fit and this significantly reduces the audio
customer_reviews.text: They are ok. I don't get a great fit and this significantly reduces the audio, especially the bass. Keeping the wire behind the neck makes phone calls impossible for the person on the other end (can't hear me). So when the fit is stable they are an ok pair of earbuds for exercise but collars or coats catch the wire and then I lose the fit.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but the enclosed silicone tips are its weakest link. Comply is a must.
customer_reviews.text: At first I wasn't too happy with this product. None of the numerous included silicone tips were a fit for me. They were all uncomfortable, to the point I would remove the earbuds after just 15 minutes of use. They were distracting during workouts too. The sound wasn't great either, compared to my previous set from Jaybird (Bluebuds X CAMO). But then I purchased a set of Comply replacement foam tips, and with that, this product worked as claimed. The sound is now impressive and balanced. Wireless is reliable and very seldom interrupted. Battery life is awesome. Setup is easy. I recommend this product, but a separate purchase of Comply Foam Tips is essential to achieve its full potential.
customer_reviews.author: Elbert Cuenca

customer_reviews.title: POWERFUL SOUND!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of JLAB Epic Earbuds, and I love them! I bought the blue ones last year and they are still rocking strong! They are some of the most comfortable earbuds I have ever owned. The sound is hard to beat; much better than higher priced urBEATS and BOSE products. The massive 13mm drivers deliver pounding bass, and excellent sound through all ranges.
customer_reviews.author: Danco1830

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I have owned
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these headphones. They work really well, hold their charge a long time, and I am always amazed by how far the blue tooth will work. I have been using them every single day for 5 months and they have held up very well. This is the second pair of wireless headphones I have tried and they are far superior to the others. Unfortunately, I just left them in the seat pocket on a flight so I'm going to have to order them again but its worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Abigail J.

customer_reviews.title: sound was great for both
customer_reviews.text: I bought these before I bought the skullcany xt free sport ones and the only difference was the skullcandy ones had alittle deeper bass, sound was great for both, plenty of ear size plugs, great distance just like my skullcandy ones and I would buy both just to mix things up for the different activities that one would find themselves in, battery life is better on this set compared to skullcandy ones but they both rock for battery life, I would buy them again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable, dependable, sound great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in September 2016 and they're still going strong as of July 2018. So far I am very impressed with these headphones. I have never had a problem with them falling out while running or being affected by sweat. In fact, just today I WASHED AND DRIED THEM when I left them in my running shorts and did a load of laundry. I found them when I was taking the shorts out of the dryer and expected the worst. I turned them on and they immediately worked, connected with my phone, and functioned perfectly. I will update if anything changes but I have no complaints and would recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: I liked the sound and how it fitted in my ear
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in July 2017. I liked the sound and how it fitted in my ear. However, before it turned in 1 year, I could no longer charge the headphone. I tried different charge cables....it didn't work.... And after i read others complaining about the same....i just gave up....for a U$100...i really expected to last much longer .... I really searched to find this Jlab...as I practice Crossfit. And while it was working, I was pleased with the product.... My wife purchased a more famous branch, even costing the double... but at least, it has been working for 2 years... mine, it stopped working after almost 9 months....
customer_reviews.author: Felipe R Oliveira

customer_reviews.title: Good product so far
customer_reviews.text: **Just bought a second pair of these for my nephew as I have loved mine so much. Work great. So far have been very happy with these headphones. I have only used for about 2 weeks, but the battery life is excellent and what I really like about them so far is the "slim" fit in my ears. Other bluetooth headphones have stuck out quite a bit, these fit in nicely and aren't overly bulky. The volume level is good, clarity is good. A bit less on the bass then I would prefer, but they are very clear sounding and they cancel out noise well for a great experience when I am working outside.
customer_reviews.author: Martin L

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: They worked great for the first 6 months, then the left side totally stopped working. I have no idea what killed it, I suspect one of the wires in the neckband broke? I'm not really curious enough to dissect them to find out. I wore them while running, sitting at my desk, and in the gym pretty regularly. It's sad they only lasted for half a year, the sound quality was good while they worked. You'd be better off buying a few pair of cheap wired headphones than these, considering the price and how quickly they broke.
customer_reviews.author: A. Santos

customer_reviews.title: excellent sound quality and battery life
customer_reviews.text: The pros: excellent sound quality and battery life. Cons: The most uncomfortable earbuds I have ever worn - tried all 6 different once supplied none worked well. Heavy in the ear - probably because the battery is in there. The controls are behind the ear - difficult and uncomfortable to get to. I use earbuds for working out - these just didn't work for me - everything about the design is annoying from the heavy earbud, the band behind the head, and the controls in back. Having said all that it was definitely the best sound of any earbud that I have worn.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Pass on these unless you don't want to hear the music
customer_reviews.text: Constantly cuts out when playing through my Samsung S7. If I have my phone in my pants pocket it will barely play at all. Skips constantly. It appears to be a proximity limitation. If I hold the phone right next to the receiver on the cord it will play consistently, but that is kind of the point of having wireless headphones. Unfortunately, a bit too inconvenient to really enjoy at all and as such I bought not only one but 2 pairs of useless $100 headphones. One was given as a gift so I look like an even bigger fool. At least they were only $100 a set (sarcasm).
customer_reviews.author: Sean Boyce

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I researched, and these were supposedly top of the line, but they continually disconnect from my Samsung S8 when no more than 3 feet apart...message: 'You are disconnected. Out of range.' I've tried a number of options like removing any cable management clips and moving the phone into different pockets without any significant change. The headset is fully charged but after about 30 minutes of use they drop with the 'out of range' message and continue to do so until I give up on them. The phone is never more than 3 feet from the headset so the out of range message is particularly frustrating. I will be returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Best Wireless Running Heaphones
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what I want them to be. Sound quality is good. I listen mostly to spoken word and would not expect great sound from Bluetooth earbuds. The battery life is excellent and, once I found the tips that fit my ear (there are a good variety included), they stay in well. The only reason I did not give the final star is that the ear piece is a little big for my preference. But, they feel fine when I run and hat was the main reason I got them.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product (New and Improved Version)
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for less than a week and am very impressed! According to the box, these are the new and improved version and I agree after reading the negative reviews. I still have about 3/4 full battery after only charging it when I unpackaged them! Battery life is one of my biggest pet peeves and these definitely don't disappoint! The sound quality is excellent and they are very comfortable and durable. They send a ton of buds to choose from, but I prefer the funny looking three layered ones because they are very comfortable and never fall ou of my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: bad reliability
customer_reviews.text: Great when work.... First one died after getting wet made loud noise that physicality hurt. Upside they replaced it. Bought second set as noone else seems to be making a better product. Died 2 months later for no apparent reason. They expect you to pay shipping and handling to ship broken device back. I don;t know... just hoping the replacement lasts until a better product is released by someone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, plenty of customization.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable fit with plenty of earpiece options. The left ear sounds scratchy, and the battery died once while it was in the case and off. Contacted JLab, and they are sending a replacement pair. I wish there was the option to have the control module on the left side, but it mainly works without dropping the connection to my phone on my left arm, only drops temporarily when my body is fully in the way between the two. Hopefully the new pair work better.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Great sound at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I have been using JLab headphones since I tried them years ago. Great sound at a great price. So I decided to treat myself and try an inexpensive upgrade. I'm glad I did. These hold a deeper, richer sound. It took a little bit of playing around to find the right comfort for me. (Which meant the largest buds and no extra wing things). Happy for the quality of the sound vs the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, signal stability
customer_reviews.text: Good sound, signal stability, and range, fit. Some issues: - Open-air range is great, but there are problems when walking and my phone is in a pocket of my pants. - Over-the ear straps could be a little more bendable (as in MEE M6 Pro) to provide a better fit. The minimal radius of the bend is too large to stay in contact with the back side of the ear. - Opening the charging port cover is kind of a pain. Update after 10 months of daily use: - The housing collapses when trying to turn on/off, making it hard to do so. The rubber coating on the button has torn. - Charging port cover doesn't stay in at all
customer_reviews.author: andrey

customer_reviews.title: Great...when they worked
customer_reviews.text: I really liked these buds...easy setup, good sound, comfortable with good range. But they are now dead after using only 5 times and fully charged. Sigh.
customer_reviews.author: Spec

customer_reviews.title: Useless for rowing, every vibration is amplified
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these, but like most earplug-style earbuds that secure tightly, every slight vibration or noise from your workout is greatly amplified. Using these on a rowing machine – where I wanted to – is the worst possible scenario. All you hear is the whoosh of the machine. Also, even when I used the snuggest plugs, in my ears they quickly fall out, losing all bass and midrange. I will go back to my old standbys, the Sony MDR-J10. (I wish JLab made a bluetooth set with earpieces similar to those.)
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great Wireless Headphones For The Office
customer_reviews.text: I'm an an office worker, and having a pair of wireless headphones that fit comfortably and have a battery life that lasts all day is important to me. The JLLab Audio Epic 2 headphones do exactly that for me. These headphones stay in while I'm walking around my workplace, eating, talking and otherwise moving my jaw, and moving my head to look around at things. The audio quality is also great for the wide variety of podcasts, news programming, and music that I listen to at the office. Also, because of these headphones light design, they can hide perfectly behind my long hair. Some people at my office didn't even know I had headphones in.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Red

customer_reviews.title: Lasts a year and a half with no care, imagine if you did take care of them!
customer_reviews.text: These were quite good! Lots of abuse handled over the year and a half of having them. They survived a trip to the washer and dryer, my sweaty head during workouts, being bundled in my pockets, and other things. Would have lasted longer if I took care of them better but given that's how it worked without care, I can say the build quality is awesome. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Doctorpat

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced for lack of sound and comfort.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I got a bad pair? Read the review on thewirecutter.com and decided to buy them. Other bluetooth headphones have a MUCH richer sound, like the Plantronics Backbeat Fit, which are my go-to running headphones now. These headphones, on the other hand, never fit comfortably and have extremely weak bass. Overall they just sound bad and are uncomfortable. I would not recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Stein

customer_reviews.title: Best fit out of all I have tried, but they broke after 1.5 months of use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these headphones as replacements for my Jaybirds X2's that had stopped working after about 6 months of use. They fit great, and stay in, even after a long run, in the heat, but they stopped working today. Planned on going for a run yesterday, but the battery was dead. Charged it, charge light went out, and was going to go workout today. Turned them on....battery full. Unfortunately, only the right bud was working. Tried turning it off, charging it, nothing. Only right bud worked. In addition, after 2 minutes the battery stated it was at medium......what gives #JLAB? Like I said, Fantastic fit, even after strenuous workout, but they stopped working after a month and a half!!
customer_reviews.author: Rafal Rogalski

customer_reviews.title: Died in less than a month
customer_reviews.text: Bought it on the recommendation of the Wirecutter. Unfortunately, it died in around 20 days of purchase. When it did work, it was subject to RF interference and there would be times the sound would clip in and out rapidly...
customer_reviews.author: Alan S.

customer_reviews.title: Not all they are reported to be...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after reading a couple of good reviews but found two issue with them. First, for me at least perspiration runs down the over the ear wire into my ear canal. May be the same with all over the ear designs but it is a bit annoying. Second and the more serious is the battery dies and won't accept a charge after six months. Tried charging them several times and it seems they are just toast. Should have lasted longer than that.
customer_reviews.author: TimB

customer_reviews.title: Not sweatproof at all
customer_reviews.text: Since initially purchasing these in July 2016, I've had three pairs dies on me because of sweat damage after a few weeks. JLab is very good with getting you a new pair if they are under warranty (during 1st year since purchase), but these earbuds are just too delicate and break way too easily. I would not recommend that anyone who is a moderate sweater or lives in a hot and humid climate buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Good, but they don't seem to last.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these in August of last year and have been using them regularly while weight training. The quality and comfortability are pretty good and I like the way they mold around my ears. With that being said, recently I noticed that the right side stopped working completely, which is frustrating. I recently contacted their customer support and requested a new pair since they claim to have a one year warranty. If I do get a replacement then JLab deserves a 5 star rating and I will update this review accordingly
customer_reviews.author: Jay Kay

customer_reviews.title: These still work but I don’t recommend. Sound quality is a D and Bluetooth range ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these headphones I have purchased. The first stopped working after a few months. These still work but I don’t recommend. Sound quality is a D and Bluetooth range is an F. I’m not even able to have my phone in my pocket without interference. The only way these work is it I hold my phone in my hand while walking. Very disappointed. I want to like these but my experience has been terrible. DONT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Blu

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Bluetooth connection - Ok sound
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to replace my Jaybird x earbuds. Worked great during setup, but the moment I stepped outside for my run it would not hold a connection to my Gear S3 or my phone (note 5). Tested several ways and ended up back inside grabbing my old reliable Jaybirds. Will be returning and looking for another solution. Come on JLab get it together. Sound quality was ok, very base heavy and loud. Could use a little more highs but actually would of loved them if they were reliable enough for a 5 miler.
customer_reviews.author: MBshopper

customer_reviews.title: but the the battery life makes it a much better set of earphones for me
customer_reviews.text: Got these after my Jaybird X2's burnt out (I used the charger for my iPad on them...too strong!). The audio quality and comfort are a solid step down compared to Jaybirds, but the the battery life makes it a much better set of earphones for me. I no longer have to take my earphones off and charge them during the day. The burn-in period was roughly 2 days of full charges. They sounded awful initially, far worse than the stock earbuds Apple packages with iPhones, but the sound warmed up considerably since then and is adequate for outdoor or noisy office use (my intended purposes). I really cannot ask for more considering the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: ji ji

customer_reviews.title: Defective or subpar
customer_reviews.text: It connected quickly and came packaged well but mine must have been defective because there was no discernible bass in my opinion. They sounded marginally clearer than any other $20 dollar set you can get. I was disappointed because of all the nice features listed and they seemed louder than other Bluetooth sets I have tried. I tried almost every bud set they offered but like I said unless mine were defective those 8mm drivers didn't make any difference in my experience with them. I had high expectations with all the reviews I read, tragic.
customer_reviews.author: slam69

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in August so, have had them for 6 months. For that time, I was very impressed. The sound quality was GREAT. Unfortunately, the hardware seems to be faulty because during my workout this morning, I started having shoddy connectivity. Then, when I stopped the music, the left earbud was crackling wildly. :( Very upset and feel like I wasted $100. What's up, JLab?!
customer_reviews.author: B. A. Weber

customer_reviews.title: Survived Washing
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds are described as sweatproof. Well, after owning them, and using them, for a few months, one day I didn't pay attention and handwashed my running shorts in soapy water WITH THE EARBUDS IN A POCKET. After a couple of minutes I realized what I had done and retrieved the earbuds. They still worked. In fact, they were unaffected. So they get my vote. To keep them in my ears, I use Comply ear tips. But that's a function of my ears, not a defect in the earbuds or the ear tips that came with them.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a runner!
customer_reviews.text: I have run about 100 miles in these so far with 0 issues. These headphones have all the functionality I need. I can change tracks, pause, adjust volume easily without having to fumble with my iphone. Battery life exceeds my expectations. I charge them about once a week. Most importantly they stay put and don't slip out. The longest run I've done so far in them is 17 miles. They were perfectly comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Bad experience ;-(
customer_reviews.text: Get something else! Received these as a gift and used them for running and in the gym for 2 weeks. Left ear piece started making static noises when powered down, stopped charging completely and then not at all. Would like to think I just lucked out with defective product and not reflective of the brand in general, since it got great reviews when I did my research. Of course, just outside of return window since it was purchased and held to be given as a gift for 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: AOL

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended, does not hold a charge.
customer_reviews.text: They work well when they work, which is only occasionally. After fully charging, and ensuring they are powered down, they're completely dead when I try to use them the next day. I sent an e-mail directy to the seller in response to their message on 9/28, but never received a reply. Unfortunately, the return window is closed, so now I'm either out the money or have to keep them charged 24/7.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Dilfield

customer_reviews.title: Stopped charging or completely shut down after months. not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed in these. For the price I expected something that lasts. 1st pair stopped charging after 6 months. Called in on the warranty, which was great. 2nd pair only lasted a month or two before completely shutting down. And I take care of them. After that I tried a different brand that was $40 and so far so good after 3 months, and the sound quality is the same
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, but a poor seal on the ear.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because of the high reviews, and they arrived on time, in good condition as expected. I tried all the different ear pieces (there were certainly a wide variety) however, I just couldn't get a good fit in my ear. The result was a loose fit which would fall out while I was running, and worse, a poor sound. If I pushed the ear pieces deep into my ears, the sound was fine - which tells me that actual head phones worked well. I just couldn't get them to "seal" in my ear and deliver that without all the outside noise as well. I ended up returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Hamtickle

customer_reviews.title: The battery life seemed impressive. For the first several ...
customer_reviews.text: The battery life seemed impressive. For the first several times I used them, the voice prompt informed me that the charge was still full but stop after 4 actual hours of used. Music skipped often during the indoor run. Lost the connection and I had to stop to turn them off and back on again 5 times in 96 minutes. If am in the Elliptical or indoor run I constantly hear interference noises or lost connection... NO BUENO!.
customer_reviews.author: manuel j hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Good as long as you don't sweat...
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed at first with fit and sound. Used them for a workout in the gym and a 5K run. Then they went downhill from there. My 3rd use was for a half marathon and about 5 miles in started getting loud static in one ear, then it started losing connection with my iphone going in and out. Then it was nothing but static and the controls stopped working. Assuming it just couldn't handle the sweat. Sorry I bought these!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Harris

customer_reviews.title: Signal cutting out from the start. Avoid.
customer_reviews.text: After an impressive quick charging time put them on and sound quality was good and a lot louder than previous Bluetooth headphones. Walked into another room and they lost signal completely, my old headphones would only cut out half-way down the stairs after leaving the flat if I forgot the iPod! Went outside with them and even with iPod in my hand it was cutting out quite often and the sound was next to useless with it in my pocket. Am sending back to Amazon after 2min use, very disappointed after hearing such good things about these. I'm assuming I just got a dud (despite being brand new) but I'm not going to risk buying them again to make sure!
customer_reviews.author: G. Director

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the JLab Epic2 on the recommendations of thewirecutter.com The sound quality was very poor. No base... I even tried to adjust with my device but nothing would help. Lucky I discovered this before the 30 days. They did refund me quite quickly. I'll stick with "beats." Daily use at the gym for over two years with the only issue being the wearing of the rubber over the ear hook.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Torres

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is quite good but useless when bluetooth connectivity is so poor
customer_reviews.text: Supremely disappointing product: bluetooth connection is the least stable of any bluetooth earbuds I have tried--cuts out when any clothing comes between the source and the earbuds. First pair of earbuds lasted for about 2 weeks (5 workouts) before ceasing to work completely. Warranty replacement lasted 2 months (about 10 workouts) before malfunctioning in right ear and ceasing to work. My workouts are runs and weightlifting--nothing that would damage or submerge the device. Sound quality is quite good but useless when bluetooth connectivity is so poor. One star awarded because company has honored the warranty twice and offered replacements. Am shocked, however, at the low quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Katroute

customer_reviews.title: I've ordered two of these...very durable!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these as my go-to workout headphones. Very rugged and suitable for any environment. Long-lasting, too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: epic 2 are great Bluetooth Ear-pods the bass just right not weak or ...
customer_reviews.text: epic 2 are great Bluetooth Ear-pods the bass just right not weak or too strong the mids and highs are just right (for me at least , sound is subjective of corse ) these vs jaybird x2 (x3 were not launched as of writing these ) very similar sound profile (not the same) the fit on these is easier and more secure than jaybird x2 the battery is better on these 12 vs 8 hrs Bluetooth 4 vs 2 on the jaybird (connect more devices ) the rest is very similar
customer_reviews.author: turki

customer_reviews.title: These are totally Awesome and well worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: These are totally Awesome and well worth the $$$. The 12-hour battery time is true, ear pieces make it possible for small folks like myself to get a great and comfortable fit, stay in place, great sound with no fluctuatin. I plan to continue to purchase this brand and model after these eventually wear out. They are a Great product.!
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Sound on these is phenomenal, love the extra base and great noise reduction. Comes with many different ear bud sizes, some don't have the noise blocking if that's what you want, but you don't get the base if you use those. They last 2 full days at work with me, which I love!!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Honeycutt

customer_reviews.title: I like them over all but they are a bit bulky ...
customer_reviews.text: I like them over all but they are a bit bulky and ive tried them with the diff bud ends and they dont feel that comfortable to me i like that you can adjust the wire by the buds around youre ears the right side slides off some times and feels unbalanced because of The charger and menu thing . It has great sound and range and battery life which is why i wanted them and decided to buy these. I also really like the color:
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Workout Headphones while they lasted
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were bought specifically to workout with. They have good to very good audio quality and mix between treble and bass. They paired well, generally, but would lose connection every so often. Problem is they died on me in less than 2 years of use. They won't hold a charge anymore and even when the light shows they're charged (which takes a long time) they don't connect or only connect briefly and then die. Needless to say, for such an expensive pair of headphones, these did not last as long as I would expect.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Barnet Smola

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, good sound, good battery life - these seemed to be great headphones for all uses. The microphone was never great but I could overlook that and give it four stars. Unfortunately after 4 months the battery stopped holding its charge and now the headphones are useless after 30 minutes. Very disappointing. Hopefully my experience is an outlier as I know these are highly rated on various review sites.
customer_reviews.author: phil

customer_reviews.title: GREAT WHILE THEY LASTED (15 hours)
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves JLabs so he was very excited to receive these JLab Bluetooth headphones for Christmas. He loved the battery life and sound quality while they worked. It is less than 3 months after Christmas and they no longer work. Charge light doesn't go on and headset is completely unresponsive. He only used them for half hour runs 2 to 3 times per week. Total time on the headset is less than 15 hours. Amazon return date is long past, so we need to find out how we can recover our costs or obtain a working headset from JLabs.
customer_reviews.author: eileen M. Clark

customer_reviews.title: What's even worse is it goes from Battery Medium alert to Battery ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this because my new phone had no standard headphone jack. It fits well, but has been really flaky in pairing -- each time I turn it on I have to put it into pairing mode before it will connect to the phone. I could live w/ this, but the battery life is miserable. I use maybe twice a week, for about 30 minutes per use. I have to charge after I'm finished or it won't have a charge the next time I go out. What's even worse is it goes from Battery Medium alert to Battery Low to I'm Turning Off in under 30 minutes. Maybe I just have a bad unit.
customer_reviews.author: Frank X. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Birthday present for daughter
customer_reviews.text: My daughter had done LOTS of research on these earbuds before finally deciding that they would fit her lifestyle quite nicely. She always had an issue with earbuds falling out while she was jogging or exercising. We literally have only had these a few days, but so far she loves them. Still trying to get a good fit in her ears, but thankfully JLab provided many sizing options for her to try.
customer_reviews.author: Rock Mom

customer_reviews.title: Okay sound, fit, battery. Exceptionally bad bluetooth range and mic.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound okay and do a great job blocking out noise without active noise cancelling. The battery life is pretty good and the wide variety of ear tips seem to allow for a pretty big range of ear shape. However, the microphone barely works (if at all?) and the bluetooth range doesn't seem to extend as far as my left pocket. I'll be returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: awesome headphones - but breaks
customer_reviews.text: My initial review: Amazing sound, keeps sounds out, and just fits perfectly in my ear. I highly recommend to my friends and to others to try them out. Updated feedback: I have twice had my right ear piece break. I currently have a new RMA have to ship it out and waiting to see if they will honor the warranty. If they replace it as expected the 2 stars will remain as no one should have this issue twice with headphones. If they for some reason do not honor it I will edit the review again with new feedback.
customer_reviews.author: StevenJones

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent Quality
customer_reviews.text: I am finished with these headphones! I LOVE how they fit, but I just had a pair short out after less than 3 months of use. I have had pairs that lasted a year. The last time I replaced them, the bluetooth was spotty. I couldn't put my phone in a pocket or walk more than 2 ft away from it. If you find a pair that work, they are great, but there must be something going on with the manufacturing to make them this inconsistent.
customer_reviews.author: Adam J. Roubitchek

customer_reviews.title: I run alot. i sweat a lot. and i have weird ears. these headphones solve all my problems.
customer_reviews.text: I train for marathons, so that means sometimes not being able to charge my devices for days. These stay charged for at least 4-5 days with no problem. Since i live in a very humid climate, i sweat A LOT. these are incredibly resistant to sweat and don't ever stop rockin'. finally, i have weird shaped ears and it's been difficult to find headphones that don't move while I run 10 to 20 miles at a time. worth. the. money.
customer_reviews.author: Teomikk

customer_reviews.title: Are you kidding me? Someone contact me quick.
customer_reviews.text: Battery will no longer charge. Less than a year for 100 bucks? I told so many people about how great these were. I'm a big audio guy and wear headphones daily at work. This company needs to back up their product. Update: Jlab gave me a code for new earbuds. Going to try out the sport. Will update when I get them.
customer_reviews.author: nick18r32

product_meta.title: JLab Audio Epic Earbuds with Massive 13mm C3 Drivers, Easy-to-Use Track Control, Customizable Cush Fins & GUARANTEED FOR LIFE - Blue/Gray
product_meta.description: Style Name:Wired| Colour Name:Blue/GrayEPIC, Earbuds Reimagined. Revolutionary Fit. Radical Sound. 8 Years. 1 EPIC pair of earbuds. That's right. The EPIC is the result of eight years of engineering, research and design. They're the new bad boy of sound - and they were created directly from customer feedback, reviews and industry know-how. 1,000 ways to rock. Comfortably. We straight ran out of ways to make old technology comfortable. So, we got innovative. Introducing Cush Fins, the revolutionary earbud system that guarantees a perfect fit and ear-lapping comfort. Coupled with seven gel tips, Cush Fins give you 1,000-plus formulas to fine-tune your listening setup. Whoa, this is big. Sound not forgotten. Just because they're comfortable doesn't mean they won't rattle your globe. The EPIC uses C3 technology to deliver clean, crisp sound no matter your flavor of music. Drench your ears in vibrant highs and song-defining mids - all delivered through JLab's high-performance 13-mm drivers, the largest driver we've ever packed into an earbud. Perhaps. But how epic would these earbuds be if they weren't built to last? Featuring a universal mic and simple track control, the flat, tangle-free cable offers additional strength when things get messy. Seriously, we tested these during a death match with a cobra, puma and liger. OK, no, we didn't. But they're pretty dang strong.
feature_bullets: Features Massive 13mm C3 (Crystal Clear Clarity) Drivers
Includes 4 Sizes Revolutionary Cush Fins and 6 Gel Tips
Universal Mic and Easy-to-Use Track Control

specifications.Customer reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
